record.field:
The company specializes in trading coal and petroleum products, acquiring them from international suppliers or local vendors and reselling them to customers. They have a unique quality-checking method during the procurement process, defining specific parameters in the GRN and Delivery stages to ensure product quality.

ConfigurationBusiness Flows Flow 1:  Purchase Quotation > Purchase Order > Receipt > Vendor BillFlow 2: Sales order > Delivery > Invoice


Configuration

  • Tolerance: Tolerance is a field that has been created on the purchase form, allowing us to define a tolerance percentage. refers to minimizing the environmental impact associated with the transportation of coal from mines to end-users. (Studio)
  • Allowed Quantity: The Allowed quantity is determined through an automated action called "Allowed Quantity on Transfer." This action calculates the quantity by subtracting the tolerance percentage from the demand quantity of the receipt transfer. (Studio)
  • Quality Parameters: The field was created in accordance with the standards and requirements of the coal industry, encompassing a range of tests and parameters. (Studio)
  • Vehicle Number: It is required to provide the vehicle number for the purpose of formal documentation. Please ensure that the vehicle number associated with the selected transportation mode, whether it is a Truck, Ship, or Train, is accurately provided. (Studio)


Business Flows 

Flow 1:  Purchase Quotation > Purchase Order > Receipt > Vendor Bill

The company obtains coal from vendors and performs quality checks when it arrives at the warehouse. Let's start with an RfQ to get a quote from vendor:

  • Create an RFQ for the "Westmines Corps" Vendor
  • Select product "Anthracite" (Any Variant)
  • Add tolerance percentage line-wise (Studio) 5%
The tolerance level is a percentage of quantity that you accept to receive, lower than the purchased quantity.

Confirm the RFQ, and go to the inventory app to receive the products:

  1. Mention the Carrier, Tracking Reference(In Additional info tab), and Vehicle Number
  2. Do the quality check, fill parameters according to the "Lab report"
  3. Assign a lot number & quantity (should be between Allowed & Demand Quantity)
  4. Validate
The Allowed quantity is computed by reducing the tolerance percentage to the demand quantity.

From the Inventory app, in Internal Transfers, process the second operation:

  • Set the destination location, and store the coal where you need it

In addition, you can create a Landed Cost from the inventory Application.

Flow 2: Sales order > Delivery > Invoice

The company delivers the goods to the customer but before delivering it. They run a quality check to make sure everything is up to the mark. Create an Quotation, Confirm it. Run quality checks and deliver the product.

To do that:

  1. Create a Quotation, and confirm it
  2. From Inventory, validate the Picking, and provide a lot number.
  3. Open the Delivery order to process it:
    • Set Quantities
    • Perform the Quality checks
    • Validate the delivery.
  5. Create an Invoice from Sale Order based on the delivered quantities
